intro: Corymborkis thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, attaching itself to trees or rocks in its natural habitat. Its flowers are often fragrant and come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, and pink. Due to its rarity and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native region.
